answers.answer: I really like fruit salads, No citrus or grapes because they cause me to throw up, pancakes with different toppings, Bacon & tomatoe grilled cheese, oatmeal with chopped strawberries & different berries, slice of pound cake with a little bit of Nutella on top with some fruit. Hope this helps ( :
Soak oats, nuts, seeds overnight. Drain and throw into blender with fruit like banana, pineapple, apple
Can also add avocado and cocoa with banana and honey to the oats mixture to have a pudding breakfast
I eat wheat toast with peanut butter and a banana... granola with yogurt....certain cereal...
Yogurt & granola with fresh fruit along with a glass of milk or your fav juice. I personally have been on a waffles and muffins kick!
Usually what the hubby n boys chose lol but I do love oatmeal :))
I make bacon, sausage patties, biscuits, waffles / pancakes. If I'on feel like cookin, I jst eat cereal or yogurt & fruit.
Do you guys think that if I ask my doctor for the list of meals he gives the women with diabetes is a good idea also?

I hate eggs also!! I eat half an avo on multigrain gluten free toast with a dash of lemon juice, paprika and pepper. If I don't have that it's usually Peanut Butter, banana, honey and cinnamon on toast. Always with a cup of tea :-) and a yoghurt and piece of fruit a little bit later on.

question: What do you ladies eat for breakfast? I can't really find anything that I like..or that sounds good. I hate eggs, so please don't say eggs lol. I want some healthy ideas that are also filling.
title: Breakfast Ideas
